embed.title: Build: Talismans
embed.description: Talismans are special, as they rely heavily on their Party Effect (combination) to be good. For Myth/God Rarities, don't invest in them if you can't activate the 4\* Party Effect. This guide recommends the balanced combinations, as they give around 80-90% of both damage and survival without compromising on either.

fields.field: Skip this Rarity entirely. Too expensive and is outclassed by IM Tier with low investment.
Immortal Talismans work much like Accessories. Due to how powerful they are, Row 1 Talis can be equipped almost immediately even at the loss of the Party Effect.
Love: 4, 5, 8 -> 5, 6, 8 (replace 4 with 6 when you hit a survival wall) Hope: 5, 6, 8 Fortune: 5, 7, 8
Up to Heaven: 2,4,6,8,10,12 dupes (42 total) Immortal requires Heaven talis: Row 1: 10,22,34,46,60, 72 (244 total) Row 2: 16,35,55,75,96,116 (393 total)
